alert.note: Alert for Le Flore; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 8:26AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Madison, Franklin, Crawford, Sebastian, southeastern Washington, southeastern Sequoyah and southeastern Le Flore Counties through 915 AM CDT... At 826 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Japton to 5 miles east of Albion. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Poteau... Ozark... Charleston... Mountainburg... Greenwood... Alma... Barling... Pocola... Heavener... Lavaca... Spiro... Arkoma... Mulberry... Mansfield... Wister... Dyer... Hackett... Howe... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 1 and 42. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 14. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
